publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3634 Stewart Stevenson: Banking in Rural Scotland—That the Parliament deplores the attempt by Clydesdale Bank to prevent the possible takeover of their closure-threatened branches by the Royal Bank of Scotland; notes that for many of the rural communities affected the existence of a bank is a vital part of their infrastructure that anchors local business and personal life, and calls on Clydesdale Bank to abandon its current “dog-in-the-manger” attitude and co-operate with any organisation willing to continue banking services in affected towns and villages.
S2M-3634 Banking in Rural Scotland (lodged on 25 November 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Jim Mather*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*, Mike Pringle*

S2M-3634 Banking in Rural Scotland (lodged on 25 November 2005) Fiona Hyslop*, Phil Gallie*, Brian Adam*, Mr John Swinney*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Donald Gorrie*, Michael Matheson*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-3634 Banking in Rural Scotland (lodged on 25 November 2005) Bruce Crawford*, Pauline McNeill*, Dennis Canavan*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-3634 Banking in Rural Scotland (lodged on 25 November 2005) John Scott*
S2M-3634 Banking in Rural Scotland (lodged on 25 November 2005) Shona Robison*
S2M-3634 Banking in Rural Scotland (lodged on 25 November 2005) Linda Fabiani*
